body:
Hi Mostapha,


sorry I just saw by chance your posting... do you still have this problem?


Have you tried with angular fish eye view? I'm also not sure if the 
keyword "Perspective" in the view file might cause a problem.
Try it with this and see if this solves your problem:


rview  -vta -vp 2.004 5.478 1.496  -vd -0.526326 -2.530093 0.0 -vu 0.0 
0.0 1.0  -vh 180.000 -vv 180.000


Although -vth is implemented in evalglare, I'm still a little suspicious 
if a hemispherical view works in all kind of situations correctly 
(especially if a glare source is close to the border). The main thing 
is, that "outside" the "circle", the view is not defined for a  
hemispherical view. If a pixel lies partly inside and outside the 
circle, problems might occur and then division by zero is causing 
overflows in variables. I tried to prevent this and for the testing 
scenes it worked.
But I still recommend also in the description to use an angular fish eye 
view, where this cannot happen. So as long as you are simulating, please 
use always a angular fish eye projection.


But, I also don´t know if this is really the problem here, but it might be.


sorry for the late answer.


Best and good luck


Jan
